popt4jlib

Interface VectorIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SparseVectorIntf
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DblArray1SparseVector, DblArray1SparseVectorFE, DblArray1SparseVectorMT, DblArray1Vector, FltArray1SparseVector, IntArray1SparseVector

    public interface VectorIntf
extends java.io.Serializable
    defines vectors in R^n. Extends the java.io.Serializable interface so that implementing objects can be transported across JVMs in distributed computation.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      divide the components of this vector by the argument h.

      get the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf object.

      return a double[] representation of this vector.
      int getNumCoords()
      return the number of components (dimensionality) of this vector.
      boolean isAtOrigin()
      return true iff all components are null (zero)

      multiply the components of this vector by the argument h.
      VectorIntf newCopy()
      return a new VectorIntf that is an exact copy of this object.
      VectorIntf newCopyMultBy(double multFactor)
      return a new VectorIntf that is an exact copy of this object but each coordinate of the new object is then multiplied by the value passed in the argument.

      return a new (un-managed) VectorIntf object that is an exact copy of this object.

                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        return a new VectorIntf object given the double[] arg passed in
        Parameters:

      • newInstance

        VectorIntf newInstance()
        return a new (un-managed) VectorIntf object that is an exact copy of this object. The only difference between this method and the method newCopy() is that the latter method may choose to return an object that is gotten from an object-pool, thus requiring invocation of release() methods eventually, if the implementing class also implements the PoolableObjectIntf interface.
        Returns:
        VectorIntf

      • newCopy

        VectorIntf newCopy()
        return a new VectorIntf that is an exact copy of this object.
        Returns:
        VectorIntf

      • newCopyMultBy

        VectorIntf newCopyMultBy(double multFactor)
        return a new VectorIntf that is an exact copy of this object but each coordinate of the new object is then multiplied by the value passed in the argument.
        Parameters:
        multFactor - double
        Returns:
        VectorIntf

        double getCoord(int coord)
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:

      • setCoord

        void setCoord(int i,
              double val)
       throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
              ParallelException
        set the value of the i-th coordinate of this object.
        Parameters:
        i - int -must be in the set {0,1,...getNumCoords()-1}
        val - double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range
        ParallelException - if the implementation supports multi-threading and a vector tries to advance a read-lock to a write-lock under unfavorable conditions.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if other is null or does not have the same dimensions as this vector
